synopsis: Aioria awakens in a snowy land, remembering everything that happened at the Wall of Grief. Awakening in a prison, he meets Lyfia who informs him that he is in Asgard. A maid serving Hilda, Lyfia is rebelling against the rule of Andreas Lise who has become the new representative after Hilda who has fallen under an illness. Lyfia informs him that Andreas is manipulating the people of Asgard and that Hilda entrusted her to stop Andreas. At first refusing to aid Lyfia due to his own battle against Hades along his companions, Aioria returns to aid Lyfia as the God Warrior Frodi ambush her. Donning his Leo Cloth, Aioria duels Frodi, and notices a strange mark on his body, which Frodi points out that its a mark belonging to deceased warriors. Aioria is unable to rival him due to Yggdrasil increasing the God Warrior's power. Seeming defeated, Aioria hears Aioros' voice which encourage him to find out why the Gold Saints have revived. Burning his Cosmo, Aioria's Cloth changes and becomes far more powerful. Once more clashing with Frodi, Aioria is able to repel the God Warrior's sword before falling unconcsious as his Cloth return to normal. As Frodi is being carried off by some soldiers, he notices a slight change in Lyfia's appearance and attitude as she cradles Aioria. Mu appears in another part of Asgard and hides from another God Warrior. (Source: Wikipedia)

Leaving Aioria to rest after his battle, Lyfia ventures out to find water or food, eventually falling unconcsious in the snow. As she recovers in an empty village, she meets a young boy who gives her something to drink. Shortly after, Mu arrives and informs her that he arrived a few days ago in the village which seemed like everyone had disappeared. Discussing a God Warrior with a dragon-shaped God Robe, Mu asks Lyfia to remain in the village and recover while he dealt with the God Warrior. Meanwhile, at an arena, Aldebaran encounters Dohko who is fighting several Asgardian soldiers for fun. As they rendezvous at a bar, the Gold Saints discuss their revival in Asgard. Before they have time for further talk, the God Warrior Hercules confronts them and challenge them. Leaving him to Aldebaran due to his previous loss during the last battle between Athena's Saints and Asgard, Dohko watches from the tribune as Aldebaran dons his Taurus Cloth. Mu ambush the God Warrior revealed to be Fafner and is easily defeated before being taken for experimenting by binding him to the roots of Yggdrasil. As Hercules attacks Aldebaran, the Gold Saints does not make a move which infuriates the God Warrior. Launching an attack at the civilians instead, Aldebaran moves in the way and deflects the attack. Realizing that Yggdrasil is the source of evil, Mu easily breaks free from the roots and regroups with Aioria before attacking Fafner, who escapes. At the same time, Aldebaran burns his Cosmo and regrows his broken horn, overpowering Hercules for a brief moment before he retreats. During their battles, both Mu and Aldebaran branded the same mark as Aioria. Finally, they all decide to journey to Yggdrasil and destroy it. Milo appears on another part of Asgard, tortuting a soldier for information. He finds out about the God Warriors and another Gold Saint. (Source: Wikipedia)

Aiolia and Lyfia head towards the village of Asgard while splitting up with Mu. Arriving in the village, they encounter Deathmask who prievously encountered Aphrodite and later hanging out at a bar. Pleading with the Cancer Gold Saint, Lyfia is simply rejected as Deathmask is satisfied with his new life, accepting it as a bonus for their sacrifice in the Underworld, showing no worries for Athena, Seiya and the Bronze Saints they sacrificed their lives for. Seemingly challenging Deathmask, Aiolia simply leaves with Lyfia, deciding to find a place to rest for the upcoming night.Meanwhile, Milo travels further through the lands of Asgard, meeting Camus who suddenly attacks him. Shortly after, Milo is confronted by the God Warrior Eikschnir Surt. Facing an attack from the God Warrior as well as Camus, Miro is sent falling down the river where he eventually meets with Shaka inside a cave. Refusing to quietly sit by and observe what happens, Milo ventures to find the God Warriors' hidden base, confronting Camus once again. Facing his former friend in a vicious battle, they are seemingly equal in powers until God Warrior Granyl Sigmund arrives to finish of Miro. However, Surt intervines and blasts the Gold Saint with his flames. At that momemt, a mysterious figure emerge from the flames surrounding Milo: the Gemini Gold Saint, Saga!  (Source: Wikipedia)
